data.Sentence_cn: 课文45  人和星系
data.Sentence: --- Lesson 45 Of men and galaxies

data.Sentence_cn: 人类社会中最具影响力的因素是什么?
data.Sentence: What is the most influential factor in any human society?

data.Sentence_cn: 在人类早期，人类与其他生物的竞争一定是必不可少的。
data.Sentence: In man's early days, competition with other creatures must have been critical.

data.Sentence_cn: 但这个发展阶段已经结束。
data.Sentence: But this phase of our development is now finished.

data.Sentence_cn: 确实，我们今天缺乏对付原始环境的实践和经验。
data.Sentence: Indeed, we lack practice and experience nowadays in dealing with primitive conditions.

data.Sentence_cn: 我断定，如果没有现代化的武器，
data.Sentence: I am sure that, without modern weapons,

data.Sentence_cn: 要我和一只熊去争洞穴，我会出洋相的；我也相信，出洋相者并非我一人。
data.Sentence: I would make a very poor show of disputing the ownership of a cave with a bear, and in this I do not think that I stand alone.

data.Sentence_cn: 能与竞争的生物最后只有蚊子，
data.Sentence: The last creature to compete with man was the mosquito.

data.Sentence_cn: 然而即使蚊子，也由于我们注意清理污水和喷洒化学药品就被制服了。
data.Sentence: But even the mosquito has been subdued by attention to drainage and by chemical sprays.

data.Sentence_cn: 然而人类之间的战争，人与人，
data.Sentence: Competition between ourselves, person against person,

data.Sentence_cn: 团体与团体，依然在进行着，而且和以前一样激烈。
data.Sentence: community against community, still persists, however; and it is as fierce as it ever was.

data.Sentence_cn: 但是，人与人的竞争并不像生物生物学中想像的那样是一个简单过程。
data.Sentence: But the competition of man against man is not the simple process envisioned in biology.

data.Sentence_cn: 它已不是为了争得物质环境所决定的有限食物而进行的简单竞争了，
data.Sentence: It is not a simple competition for a fixed amount of food determined by the physical environment,

data.Sentence_cn: 因为决定我们进化环境的主要方面已不再是物质。
data.Sentence: because the environment that determines our evolution is no longer essentially physical.

data.Sentence_cn: 我们的环境主要是由我们所相信的东西所决定。
data.Sentence: Our environment is chiefly conditoned by the things we believe.

data.Sentence_cn: 摩洛哥和加利福尼亚是地球上纬度极其相似的两个地方，
data.Sentence: Morocco and California are bits of the Earth in very similar latitudes,

data.Sentence_cn: 都在各自大陆的西海岸，气候相似，自然资源也可能相似。
data.Sentence: both on the west coasts of continents with similar climates, and probably with rather similar natural resources.

data.Sentence_cn: 但是，这两个地方目前的发展程度完全不一样。
data.Sentence: Yet their present development is wholly different,

data.Sentence_cn: 这倒不是因为人民不同，
data.Sentence: not so much because of different people even,

data.Sentence_cn: 而是由于居民头脑中的思想不同。
data.Sentence: but because of the different thoughts that exist in the minds of their inhabitants.

data.Sentence_cn: 这是我要强调的论点。
data.Sentence: This is the point I wish to emphasize.

data.Sentence_cn: 我们环境中最重要的因素就是我们的思想状况。
data.Sentence: The most important factor in our environment is the state of our own minds.

data.Sentence_cn: 众所周知，凡是白人侵入原始文化的地方，
data.Sentence: It is well known that where the white man has invaded a primitive culture,

data.Sentence_cn: 破坏作用最大的不是杀人的武器，而是思想。
data.Sentence: the most destructive effects have come not from physical weapons but from ideas.

data.Sentence_cn: 思想是危险的。
data.Sentence: Ideas are dangerous.

data.Sentence_cn: 宗教法庭对此是非常清楚的，因此从前它总是把异教徒烧死。
data.Sentence: The Holy Office knew this full well when it caused heretics to be burned in days gone by.

data.Sentence_cn: 的确，言论自由的概念只存在于我们现代社会中，因为当你生活在一个社团中时，
data.Sentence: Indeed, the concept of free speech only exists in our modern society because when you are inside a community,

data.Sentence_cn: 社团的风俗习惯会严格地制约你，使你很难有破坏性的想法。
data.Sentence: you are conditioned by the conventions of the community to such a degree that it is very difficult to conceive of anything really destructive.

data.Sentence_cn: 只有外部的旁观者才能灌输危险的思想。
data.Sentence: It is only someone looking on from outside that can inject the dangerous thoughts.

data.Sentence_cn: 向现代世界灌输一种思想以便摧毁我们人类是可能的事，对此我并不怀疑。
data.Sentence: I do not doubt that it would be possible to inject ideas into the modern world that would utterly destroy us.

data.Sentence_cn: 我愿为你举个例子，但幸亏我举不出。
data.Sentence: I would like to give you an example, but fortunately I cannot do so.

data.Sentence_cn: 也许提一下核弹就足以证明了。
data.Sentence: Perhaps it will suffice to mention the nuclear bomb.

data.Sentence_cn: 对一个沿未拥有核弹、但科技相当发达的社会，
data.Sentence: Imagine the effect on a reasonably advanced technological society,

data.Sentence_cn: 如果告诉它制造核弹的可能性，而且向它提供制造核弹的细节，那么可以设想，这将对这个社会产生何等的影响。
data.Sentence: one that still does not possess the bomb, of making it aware of the possibility, of supplying suffcient details to enable the thing to be constructed.

data.Sentence_cn: 如果把二三十页的情报交给1952年前后的任何一个世界强国，
data.Sentence: 20 or 30 pages of information handed to any of the major world powers around the year 1925,

data.Sentence_cn: 就足以改变世界历史的进程。
data.Sentence: would have been sufficient to change the course of world history.

data.Sentence_cn: 这是个离奇的想法。不过我认为这个想法是正确的。
data.Sentence: It is a strange thought, but I believe a correct one,

data.Sentence_cn: 二三十页材料中的思想和情报会便当今的世界翻天覆地，甚至毁灭这个世界。
data.Sentence: that twenty or thirty pages of ideas and information would be capable of turning the present-day world upside down, or even destroying it.

data.Sentence_cn: 我常常试图想像这些纸上所写的东西，
data.Sentence: I have often tried to conceive of what those pages might contain,

data.Sentence_cn: 不过我是做不到的，因为我和你们大家一样，是当今世界上的凡人。
data.Sentence: but of course I cannot do so because I am a prisoner of the present-day world, just as all of you are.

data.Sentence_cn: 我们不能脱离我们大脑所限定的模式去问题，
data.Sentence: We cannot think outside the particular patterns that our brains are conditioned to, or,

data.Sentence_cn: 我们只能稍微离开一点儿，就这也需要我们独创的思想。
data.Sentence: to be more accurate we can think only a very little way outside and then only if we are very original.
